dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool allows spatially querying OSM data using the Overpass API.

Missing features and bugs can be reported on GitHub.

tool.name: Tool

param.name: in_tag
param.expression: shop | amenity | office | waterway | sport | cuisine | power | man_made | cycleway | boundary | highway | admin_level | junction | emergency | leisure | historic | tourism | building | natural | evacuation_center | craft | place | public_transport | railway | landuse | route
param.dialogReference: The OSM tag key to be used. There is no finite set of keys but the provided list summarises the most widely used keys.

param.name: in_key
param.dialogReference: The OSM tag value(s) to be used. There is no finite set of values but the provided list summarises the most widely used values for the selected key.

param.name: in_regMode
param.expression: Geocode a region name | Define a bounding box
param.dialogReference: Choose how you wish to indicate the spatial extent for which OSM should be queried: Choose between geocoding a region name (using Nominatim) or supplying a bounding box (e.g. the currently visible extent).

param.name: in_region
param.dialogReference:
Region name to be used as spatial extent for querying OSM data. This region name will be geocoded using Nominatim.

Example: "Paris, France".

param.name: in_bbox
param.dialogReference: The bounding box to be used as spatial extent for querying OSM data.

tool.summary:
This tool allows spatially querying OSM data using the Overpass API.

Missing features and bugs can be reported on GitHub.
tool.usage: Select an OSM tag key and tag value and limit your request to a suitably small bounding box.
